summary: Project now includes a “Verify Number” feature where users manually enter 1–15 numbers and verify them; scope expanded to add a voice recording option that transcribes spoken digits to auto-fill the 1–15 inputs and improves failure results to show which number(s) were not called/spoken.
architectural_notes: Use speech-to-text to transcribe a single audio recording into a sequence of digits and map them into the 1–15 verification inputs; keep manual entry available as fallback.

existing_features.title: Update the existing “Verify Called Numbers” (Verify Number) UI to use 15 separate inputs (positions 1–15) instead of a single comma/space-separated text field, while still allowing manual typing in any position.

Add a voice recording option to the Verify Number section that records all numbers in one recording, transcribes speech into digits, and auto-fills the 1–15 input boxes in order, while keeping manual typing available as a fallback.
Improve verification failure results so that when verification fails, the UI displays exactly which entered number(s) have not been called (instead of a generic “number not called” message).

new_feature_requests.summary: Add voice recording option to Verify Number: record all numbers in one recording, transcribe to digits, and auto-fill the 1–15 input boxes while still allowing manual typing.
On verification failure, display which specific number(s)/input positions were not called/spoken (missing) to clarify why verification failed.

projectName: Add voice-to-digits autofill and clearer failure details in Verify Number
